name: Grammar for Everyone
long_desc: This is a minicourse in fundamental grammatical structures of English and how these structures fit into the writers toolkit. This means you will learn a lot about Englishlanguage grammar in this course en route to understanding a lot about English language writing. This course is designed for students with no grammar background, for students with lots of grammar background, for students with no writing background, and for students with lots of writing background. The novel focus of this mini is on how grammatical knowledge can support and systematize your writing knowledge and practice.

custom_fields.goals: students will learn to distinguish the noun vs. verb stylethe formal definition of phrase and to prune phrases when their sentences have too manythe difference between strong and weak verbs and how they matter to writing effectivelythe various parts of the expanding verb phrase and how it captures subtly every writer needs to capturethe various parts of a sentence and the proportionality of sentence length needed for good writingthe occurrence of nouns modifying other nouns and the implications for writing to general vs. specialized audiencesvarious strategies for elaborating a core sentence to maximize sentence variety
custom_fields.assessment_structure:
OLI learning by doing exercises and quizzes


diagramming exercises


paper quizzes


midterm and final exam
custom_fields.relevance: Even when they are adequate writers, students can lack confidence in their sentences if they don't have a thorough understanding of grammar. And if their writing is below par, ignorance of grammar can make it difficult for students to improve their writing. This course seeks to address these problems by providing the foundations of grammar that every writer needs.
